      • getPermissiblePropertyName

        public static java.lang.String getPermissiblePropertyName(java.lang.Class permClass,
                                                          java.lang.String type)

      • getImplementedActions

        public abstract java.lang.String[] getImplementedActions()
        Returns a set of actions that this Permissible object implements. An object may not need all possible actions that a permission may allow. It may only need a subset of them
        Returns:

      • getPermission

        public Permission getPermission(boolean own)
        Retruns the permission object associated with this permissible object.
        Parameters:
        own - if true, it will only return the permission associated with this specific object or null if none existing. Otherwise it returns the permission associated with this object, or, if null, the global permission associated with the object class
        Returns:
        the permission object

      • getPermissibleCategory

        public abstract java.lang.Class getPermissibleCategory()
        Returns:
        the object category to identify specific permission objects. This is usually a constant stored in Permissible and it usually represents its Class.

      • getAllowedActions

        public java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getAllowedActions(java.util.Map scope)
        Gets the list of linked permissions with this object. Queries the permissions to produce a set of unique allowed actions for this object.
        Parameters:
        scope - a map with the scope of the application (various variables like request, session or parts of request, session - currentMember, etc... that are relevant for the Gate logic All the actions that are not implemented by the Permissible object will be retained.
        Returns:
        the collection of unique allowed actions
        See Also:
        getImplementedActions()

      • buildImplementedActionsAsList

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> buildImplementedActionsAsList()
        getImplementedActions() is, by default, a clone() call (for safety reasons) - which is very expensive. Because this function always returns the same value for a class instance (and even for a class, but let's be paranoid about it), we'll cache Arrays.asList(getImplementedActions()) per instance
        Returns:

      • getPermissionMap

        protected PermissionMap getPermissionMap()

      • processPermissions

        public static java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> processPermissions(PermissionMap permissionMapForPermissible,
                                                                        java.util.Map scope)

                                                                       java.lang.Class permissibleClass,
                                                                       java.util.Map scope)

      • canDo

        public boolean canDo(java.lang.String actionName,
                     java.util.Map scope)
        Returns true if the current object is allowed to do the specified action for the given scope
        Parameters:
        actionName - the name of the action defined in GatePermConst class
        scope - the scope with the objects that represent the current state of amp - eg: request,session,etc...
        Returns:
        See Also:
        GatePermConst
